short_summary: One CNC Milling Machine to be delivered to RCMP in St.John's, NL
description: A detailed requirement is included in Annex A. All deliverables must be received on or before March 31, 2023
full_summary:
## Computer Numerical Control (CNC) Milling Machine ^ [1](#fn1)

### Request for Proposal

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) is seeking a contract for the delivery of a Computer Numerical Control (CNC) milling machine to be operated at the RCMP facility in St. John’s, Newfoundland and Labrador. The procurement process is open to all qualified suppliers.

### Tender Details

*   **Reference Number**: PW-23-01020713
*   **Publication Date**: January 10, 2023
*   **Tender Closing Date**: January 26, 2023 (13:00:00 hours)
*   **Amendment Date**: None
*   **Expected Contract Start Date**: None
*   **Expected Contract End Date**: None

### Tender Procedure

A bid must comply with the requirements of the bid solicitation and meet all mandatory technical evaluation criteria to be declared responsive. The responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for award of a contract. Tenders must be submitted to the RCMP Bid Receiving Unit at <atl_procurement@rcmp-grc.gc-ca>. A detailed tender description and the bid solicitation can be found in the attached tender documents.

### Language of Communication

The attached document may be submitted in either official language of Canada (English or French).

### Important Notes

Canada retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement. Canada will make available notices of proposed procurement (NPP), bid solicitations and related documents for download through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS).  In the event of an NPP, bid solicitation or related documentation is amended, Canada will not send notifications. Canada will post all amendments, including significant enquiries received and their replies, using GETS. The sole responsibility of the Bidder is to regularly consult GETS for the most up-to-date information.

### Procurement Strategy and Indigenous Procurement

Novel approach:Canada encourages all suppliers to develop and adopt procurement strategies that provide equal opportunities for Indigenous businesses to participate in Canadian procurement opportunities. Furthermore, Canada recognizes the importance of building awareness of Indigenous procurement opportunities and promoting this among its suppliers. Suppliers will be awarded upwards of 5 points for led (through tender response ensuring they should adopt the process) 

### Contact Information

For more information, please contact Sandra Bremner (Procurement Officer) at sandra.bremner@rcmp-grc.gc.ca or (902) 717-5395.
